Local Video - YouTube From Your Location

Jan 15, 2016

Local Video is a simple Ruby on Rails application I built that uses YouTube’s API to pull videos that it has tagged as being near your coordinates. I’m still not entirely certain how YouTube classifies the video locations but from what I’ve seen it’s likely to be some combination of upload location and possibly video metadata. Either way, this tool tends to find some cool videos shot locally to you (and a lot of apartment listing videos as well).

The application itself is a basic Ruby on Rails app with a Postgres database. Essentially I just get the user location with the HTML5 Geolocation API and pass that to the YouTube video API.
